verses.kjv: Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity builded the temple unto the LORD God of Israel;
verses.ct: When the enemies of Judah and Benjamin found out that the returned exiles were building a temple for the LORD God of Israel,

verses.kjv: Then they came to Zerubbabel, and to the chief of the fathers, and said unto them, Let us build with you: for we seek your God, as ye do; and we do sacrifice unto him since the days of Esarhaddon king of Assur, which brought us up hither.
verses.ct: they approached Zerubbabel and the family leaders and said to them, "Let us help you build! We worship your God just like you do. We've been offering sacrifices to him ever since King Esarhaddon of Assyria brought us here."

verses.kjv: But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and the rest of the chief of the fathers of Israel, said unto them, Ye have nothing to do with us to build an house unto our God; but we ourselves together will build unto the LORD God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia hath commanded us.
verses.ct: But Zerubbabel, Jeshua, and the other family leaders of Israel told them, "You have no part with us in building a house for our God. We alone will build it for the LORD God of Israel, just as King Cyrus of Persia ordered us to do."

verses.kjv: Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah, and troubled them in building,
verses.ct: Then the local people began to discourage the people of Judah and make the construction difficult for them.

verses.kjv: And hired counsellors against them, to frustrate their purpose, all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius king of Persia.
verses.ct: They also hired advisors to work against them and undermine their plans. This went on throughout the entire reign of King Cyrus of Persia and continued until King Darius of Persia took the throne.

verses.kjv: And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, wrote they unto him an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: At the start of the reign of Ahasuerus, they submitted a written accusation against the residents of Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of their companions, unto Artaxerxes king of Persia; and the writing of the letter was written in the Syrian tongue, and interpreted in the Syrian tongue.
verses.ct: During the reign of Artaxerxes, Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and their associates wrote a letter to King Artaxerxes of Persia. The letter was composed in Aramaic and translated from Aramaic.

verses.kjv: Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort:
verses.ct: Rehum the commanding officer and Shimshai the secretary drafted a letter against Jerusalem to King Artaxerxes. It read as follows:

verses.kjv: Then wrote Rehum the chancellor, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions; the Dinaites, the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Susanchites, the Dehavites, and the Elamites,
verses.ct: From Rehum the commanding officer, Shimshai the secretary, and their associates — the Dinaites, the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Susanchites, the Dehavites, and the Elamites,

verses.kjv: And the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asnapper brought over, and set in the cities of Samaria, and the rest that are on this side the river, and at such a time.
verses.ct: along with the other peoples that the great and honorable Asnapper deported and resettled in the cities of Samaria and throughout the rest of the province west of the Euphrates River.

verses.kjv: This is the copy of the letter that they sent unto him, even unto Artaxerxes the king; Thy servants the men on this side the river, and at such a time.
verses.ct: Here is a copy of the letter they sent to him: "To King Artaxerxes, from your servants living in the province west of the Euphrates River.

verses.kjv: Be it known unto the king, that the Jews which came up from thee to us are come unto Jerusalem, building the rebellious and the bad city, and have set up the walls thereof, and joined the foundations.
verses.ct: The king should know that the Jews who came from you to us have arrived in Jerusalem. They are rebuilding that rebellious and wicked city, repairing its walls and restoring its foundations.

verses.kjv: Be it known now unto the king, that, if this city be builded, and the walls set up again, then will they not pay toll, tribute, and custom, and so thou shalt endamage the revenue of the kings.
verses.ct: The king should also know that if this city is rebuilt and its walls are completed, the people will refuse to pay taxes, tribute, or duties, and the royal treasury will suffer losses.

verses.kjv: Now because we have maintenance from the king’s palace, and it was not meet for us to see the king’s dishonour, therefore have we sent and certified the king;
verses.ct: Since we receive our support from the palace and it would be wrong for us to stand by while the king is dishonored, we are sending this report to inform the king.

verses.kjv: That search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers: so shalt thou find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.
verses.ct: We urge you to search the historical records of your predecessors. You will discover in those records that this city has a long history of rebellion, causing trouble for kings and provinces. Uprisings have been stirred up there since ancient times. That is exactly why this city was destroyed.

verses.kjv: We certify the king that, if this city be builded again, and the walls thereof set up, by this means thou shalt have no portion on this side the river.
verses.ct: We want the king to understand that if this city is rebuilt and its walls are restored, you will lose control of the entire province west of the Euphrates River."

verses.kjv: Then sent the king an answer unto Rehum the chancellor, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and unto the rest beyond the river, Peace, and at such a time.
verses.ct: The king sent this reply to Rehum the commanding officer, Shimshai the secretary, and their associates living in Samaria and the rest of the province west of the Euphrates River: "Greetings.

verses.kjv: The letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me.
verses.ct: The letter you sent to us has been read aloud and translated in my presence.

verses.kjv: And I commanded, and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein.
verses.ct: I gave orders for a search to be conducted, and it has been confirmed that this city has a long history of rising up against kings, with rebellion and revolt taking place there repeatedly.

verses.kjv: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, which have ruled over all countries beyond the river; and toll, tribute, and custom, was paid unto them.
verses.ct: Powerful kings once ruled from Jerusalem and controlled the entire region west of the Euphrates, collecting taxes, tribute, and duties.

verses.kjv: Give ye now commandment to cause these men to cease, and that this city be not builded, until another commandment shall be given from me.
verses.ct: Therefore, issue an order for these men to stop their work. This city must not be rebuilt until I personally give further instructions.

verses.kjv: Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?
verses.ct: Make sure you act on this without delay. Why should we allow this situation to grow and cause harm to the royal interests?"

verses.kjv: Now when the copy of king Artaxerxes’ letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went up in haste to Jerusalem unto the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power.
verses.ct: As soon as the copy of King Artaxerxes' letter was read to Rehum, Shimshai the secretary, and their associates, they rushed to Jerusalem and forced the Jews to stop building.

verses.kjv: Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem. So it ceased unto the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
verses.ct: So the construction on the house of God in Jerusalem came to a halt. It remained stopped until the 2nd year of the reign of King Darius of Persia.
